intro: Bromus sibiricus var. barguzinensis, commonly known as the Barguzin grass, is a perennial grass species native to the cold climates of Siberia and Central Asia. It typically grows in open, moist habitats such as tundra, meadows, and riverbanks. The plant has slender,丛生 (tufted) stems that can reach heights of up to 50 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, spikelet-bearing flowers. This variety is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, exhibiting frost resistance and efficient water use.
